Address: 224 Wild Cherry Road Lockwood South VIC 3551
Description:
A Grand Entertainer
Click links for video
Luxury and lifestyle What you have been searching for.
Following the driveway through the picturesque creek you will be impressed by the stunning feature home taking in the spectacular views.
Whether you ride horses, need a property the whole family can enjoy or wish to graze cattle, this is a property of grand proportion, comprising a beautiful seasonal creek and 5 paddocks.
The 2-year-old beautifully presented contemporary home consists of 4 bedrooms (main bedroom with walk in robe and stunning ensuite) and uninterrupted views.
Cleverly designed with a childrens wing offering 3 large bedrooms, two with walk in robes, large playroom, separate study with built in shelving and desks. Separate powder-room with electric hand dryer and large bathroom with dual sinks.
Direct access from the playroom to the putt-putt green and outdoor entertaining area allows both adults and children to enjoy the functionality of this property.
For the sports enthusiast, a purpose-built half-court basketball court completes the childhood dream.
Entertaining or simply enjoying your own space, this kitchen will be envied by all. Featuring a large island bench, impressive butlers pantry, 2 x 900mm Smeg electric wall ovens, 900mm Smeg gas hotplates, large plumbed fridge space, stone benchtops and beautiful detailed timber features.
Large stackable sliding doors with electric blinds allow for seamless indoor/outdoor living. SONOS built in speakers with 5 separate zones to help set the mood.
Polished concrete floors, high ceilings, large windows with uninterrupted stunning views, ducted refrigerated air conditioning and ducted gas heating are features of the substantial family home.
Inside Features:
Large main bedroom with walk in robe and ensuite
4 separate living areas
3 other bedrooms 2 with walk in robes
Playroom and childrens study
2 separate study's
Movie room with built in screen and projector
Open plan kitchen with Butlers pantry
Extra storage room in oversized garage
Ducted refrigerated cooling and gas heating
4 door linen press plus further storage
Outside Features:
Extra-large double garage with auto door
Large pergola for entertaining
Built in Putt Putt green
Purpose built basketball half-court
Large secure chicken run
Large covered machinery storage
100,000 litre rainwater tank
1 Dam and 5 fenced paddocks
Seasonal creek
A spectacular family home Located 25 minutes to Bendigo CBD and easy access to the Calder highway for a stress-free commute to Melbourne.
Properties this special are rare and held tightly.
Dont let this be your if only property.

Description:
Meticulously Presented With Everything You Could Desire!
The most difficult part of inspecting this beautiful property will be the moment you have to leave, as it wont take long to fall in love with the extensive inclusions, facilities, and quality of this stunning family home, with something for everyone, and everything in its place.
Spacious residence with formal entry, 4 bedrooms with main including ensuite and walk-in-robe, open plan kitchen/meals and living, separate formal lounge, plus a third family area with views over the yard and pool.
Modern stainless-steel appliances and quality fixtures and fittings throughout.
Entertainers dream with substantial undercover outdoor entertaining area, with sectioned areas that include Vergola roof and privacy screening. Also, the perfect place for unwinding and relaxation amongst serene surrounds.
Further appealing attributes include an amazing Balinese Hut with power, where you can relax on the day bed, overlooking the large inground solar heated swimming pool. Large workshop measures approximately 7m x 4.2m and is conveniently equipped with reverse cycle air-conditioner, along with an external toilet.
Large 945m2 allotment with clear side access to securely park your caravan, boat or trailer. Established gardens and lawn area for children and pets to play. 3Kw solar power system will assist in keeping energy costs to a minimum.
An opportunity to become only the second owner of this impressive property where all the hard work has been perfectly completed. Situated in one of the most popular estates in Strathfieldsaye, a short walk to local daycare facilities and park, and close proximity to schools, supermarket, and recreational facilities.
For a private inspection, please contact Bawa on 0402 206 745.

Description:
ABSOLUTELY IMMACULATE!
Beautifully looked after, this well-appointed residence will set you up for a lifestyle of leisure and comfort. Just moments from the centre of Bendigo, situated on a corner block in a great neighbourhood. Conveniently close to walking and bicycle tracks, the hospital, public transport, and all amenities.
It is appealing to professional couples, investors, first home buyers, retirees, and lifestyle lovers. For the savvy investor this property has been previously rented furnished at $490.00 per week. Before this it was a very successful Airbnb. It can be purchased vacant and is ready to go, nothing to spend!
The home offers quality fixtures and fittings complemented by fresh light tones emphasising space and light throughout. Designed with both privacy and entertaining in mind, the open floor plan with a well-appointed kitchen, through glass sliders to the private and sunny courtyard. The alfresco area is paved and the gardens include automatic watering systems for minimal upkeep and maximum enjoyment.
Spacious open plan living/dining, kitchen
Modern kitchen with ample storage and stainless steel appliances
Two well-proportioned bedrooms
Private courtyard
Gardens with automatic watering system
Electronic key-less entry
Solar Hot Water
Remote Control garage roller door
Single titled property, no body corp.
With nothing more to do, simply move in & enjoy life in a peaceful inner city location.

Description:
IMMACULATE CONTEMPORARY FAMILY HOME
Positioned in the heart of the popular McIvor Forest Estate, this contemporary home is just a block from playground and reserve, and the walking track leading in to the Greater Bendigo National Park sits at the back door. The property, built just three years ago on a wide allotment, offers quality fixtures and fittings throughout a modern, light-filled space.
The neat and tidy façade includes a landscaped front garden and access to a triple garage, providing ample off-street parking. Indoors, a wide entry opens on one side to a spacious master suite which features a walk-through his-and-hers robe leading to an ensuite with walk-in shower and double vanity. Three further bedrooms, all with built-in robes, can be found in a separate childrens wing off the kitchen area. This section of the home also features a modern family bathroom, separate toilet and a light and bright laundry with sliding door access to the side of the home.
Further down the entry hall is a formal lounge that is fully set up as a theatre room with screen, projector and surround sound speakers. Beyond this space is an open plan kitchen diner. Clerestory windows and double glass sliding doors flood the space with natural light and the kitchen enjoys quality appliances, stone benchtops and a sizeable walk-in pantry. Off the dining space is a living room overlooking the rear yard.
With two outdoor entertaining areas, there is space for friends and family year-round. At the back, a sliding door from the living room opens to an alfresco with lights and power. This overlooks a lawn area and beyond the rear fence is a path leading to the many tracks and trails of the forest that surrounds the estate. Off the dining space, double sliders open to a sunny courtyard with water feature and easy-care garden beds. At the other side of the block is gravel area, garden shed and a roller door from the garage provides vehicle access to the backyard.
Additional features include:
Ducted evaporative cooling and ducted gas heating
Quality kitchen appliances including dishwasher and 900mm stone with five-burner gas cooktop
Theatre room with screen, projector and speakers
Secure access from garage to home
Roller door from garage to rear yard
Garden shed
Two entertaining areas
Absolutely ideal for a buyer seeking a quality, modern property in a family-friendly locale, this light-filled home is perfectly positioned to make the most of outdoor activities and is less than 10 minutes from Bendigos CBD.

Description:
IMMACULATE TOWNHOUSE IN STUNNING ST AIDANS PARK
This stunning property is located in a row of stylishly-built beautiful townhouses, created to sit alongside the old St Aidans Orphanage and the grounds surrounding. Perfectly situated in easy walking distance from Strath Village, Strath Hill and Kennington Reservoir.
The private front yard sits behind a picket fence and the front deck is the perfect place to sit and smell the roses. Indoors, a dedicated entry hall leads into the formal lounge a spacious and light-filled room with a large picture window. Between this room and the open plan kitchen, living and dining room beyond is a large euro laundry, neatly tucked away, as well as a full powder room. The kitchen features granite benchtops, quality appliances and under bench storage on both sides of the generous island.
Carpeted stairs lead from the front lounge to the second floor and a skylight above the stairwell, as well as in the family bathroom, offers additional natural light. Two good-sized bedrooms overlook the rear yard and the generous master is positioned to make the most of the outlook across the formal gardens. Glass doors from the master lead out to a balcony, providing plenty of light and beautiful sunrise views over the city. This room also features a large walk-in robe, and an ensuite providing a beautiful outlook of the estate and beyond from the cathedral window.
Downstairs, the backyard can be access via the main living space. Glass sliding doors lead out to a decked alfresco area and private lawn. At the end of the easy-care garden is the double garage, which is accessed via a private driveway set aside strictly for tenants.
Additional features include:
Reverse cycle ducted refrigerative cooling and heating
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, oven and four-burner gas cooktop
Great storage throughout
Access to double garage via private driveway
Body corporate fees include garden maintenance
With a flexible layout, plenty of space and storage, and positioned a short walking distance to all amenities, this low-maintenance and secure property is perfect for a buyer wanting to sit back and enjoy the easy life in an immaculate, contemporary home.

Description:
A Beautiful Home In A Central Location.
A beautiful historic home, brimming with character and personality.
Boasting rich timber floors, the intricate beauty of leadlight windows, the forgotten charm of delicate ceiling roses and lace-like fretwork. This sort of love and attention is just not put into properties in this day and age.
Having been restumped recently, solar panels added, and with ducted heating and evaporative cooling throughout this beautiful home, there are all of the benefits of a period home with all the conveniences of modern living.
And if it is convenience you are looking for, location does not get much better than this with the Bendigo CBD at your doorstep.
The property has fantastic side access which leads to a large rear yard with lock up garage/shed and also offers a water tank to ensure gardens can stay green year-round.
This really is such a gem available in this tightly held pocket of Bendigo.

Description:
BIG FAMILY? NO PROBLEM!!
Located in the ever-popular Maiden Gully is this immaculately presented family home. Recently rejuvenated with new kitchen, new carpets, new blinds and fresh paint, this supersized five bedroom plus study home also boasts three huge living spaces and an enviable shed all on a 1489m2 allotment. With the local IGA Supermarket, primary and secondary schools, chemist, bakery, Pratty's Patch, bushland for walking/bike riding all nearby and a 10-minute drive to the CBD of Bendigo, the location is excellent.
Built in 2007, the well thought out floor plan features a master bedroom with full ensuite and walk in robe located at the front of the home, as is the study/home office with built in shelving. The first of the three living spaces is the huge 9m x 4.5m carpeted lounge or parents retreat. Further on finds the open-plan kitchen/meals/living space. The new kitchen is well-equipped with modern appliances including stainless steel gas cooktop, 900mm oven, dishwasher, plenty of pot drawers and bench space. The meals/living space easily caters for the family dining table and lounge. The third living space, a large rumpus/theatre room with built in desk and robe for storage, is at the rear of the home. A second bathroom with shower and bath, a separate toilet and powder room service the remaining four bedrooms. Other notable features include ducted heating and cooling throughout, good sized laundry and a double garage with auto door and internal access to a large mud/storage room with extensive shelving.
Stepping outside finds an enormous 18m x 6.5m alfresco/entertaining space that is fully enclosed so you can enjoy those summer BBQ's without the pesky insects. An 8m x 5m fully lined shed/mancave with its very own shower, toilet, cabinetry and split system is perfect as a games room with enough space for a pool table or table tennis etc. There is also a 3m x 3m garden shed with concrete floor to store the garden tools and mower, a large water tank with pump that provides water for the landscaped garden and freshly laid turf. There's handy side access for the caravan, boat or other vehicles, all on a generous 1,489m2 allotment.
This home is ideal for the growing family, those that love to entertain, with plenty of yard space to add a pool if desired. Certain to generate a lot of interest, so book your private inspection today.

Description:
Large Building and Substantial Allotment in Central Bendigo Commercial or Residential
The address speaks for itself. 58 Mundy Street, Bendigo. A central location, extremely close to office buildings, supermarkets, restaurants, and elite residential homes. The potential for commercial or residential development is enormous.
On approximately 646sqm, this two storey property is suitable for immediate occupancy from residential or commercial tenants. With 10 car parking spaces at the rear, data cabling throughout, and separate water and power meters installed, you will be able to generate an income from one or multiple tenants from Day 1. It is also an exceptional opportunity for business owners to stop paying rent and occupy your own premises.
Each level has virtually identical floorplans consisting of two office spaces/bedrooms, a large living room, bathroom, kitchen and dining area. Each also has heating and cooling and double door access to a balconette looking towards Mundy Street, plus upstairs has a small balcony to the rear which captures the views of the city skyline.
Looking towards the future, and what may be' Concept drawings have been completed, with a view to developing up to 8 apartments with underground parking behind the existing building. Situated in the CBD H3 area, buildings could be constructed up to 12m in height (STCA).
A total refurbishment would take the existing property to the next level, though paying tribute to the art deco features including decorative glass, checkerboard fireplace hearths, and huge stunning ceiling plaster works would likely be taken into account. There is also the opportunity to create a shopfront downstairs, without the need for altering the existing entrance to upstairs (STCA).
In all aspects, this flexible and desirable property in Central Bendigo is an attractive prospect to investors, developers, owner occupiers and tenants.
Insights: 58 Mundy Street, Bendigo VIC 3550 was last sold in 1999 and 27 other 4 bedroom house in Bendigo have recently been sold.

Description:
First Class Blue Chip Location!
If you have been searching for a family home in the right location on a good size allotment then look no further. Situated in the prestigious McIvor Hill precinct only a short drive into the CBD this 4 bedroom home includes built in robes, walk in robe and ensuite to main, formal lounge, large open plan kitchen/meals/living, ducted heating and cooling throughout, 3 piece family bathroom with spa and generous laundry with storage. From inside to out the home includes a large alfresco area off the living, double garage and handy carport for an extra vehicle, boat or caravan. The home sits on a generous corner allotment facing Doak and Austen terrace with handy side entrance into the yard for the caravan. This is an excellent opportunity to acquire one of Bendigo's best locations. Don't delay. Will not last.

Description:
Central Sanctuary
We are proud to present this beautifully refurbished home in the enviable McIvor Hill locale which showcases the timeless Hamptons style. The light filled lounge, study and family room all enjoy bush views, while the fourth bedroom, kitchen, dining room, laundry and bathroom complete the downstairs accommodation. Upstairs you will find a gorgeous north facing master bedroom/retreat with a new ensuite, walk in robe and balcony. In addition to this are the second and third bedrooms and new bathroom. An abundance of storage room is also found upstairs as well as a second balcony. To complete this home is a north facing front verandah and a large shaded rear entertaining deck. These offer a quiet place to relax and enjoy the serenity or lots of space to entertain. Other features include SS A/C, ducted heating and cooling, garden shed, sprinklers, bitumen circular driveway and a double carport. Solomon Street is handy to parks , sporting grounds, supermarket, shops, eateries, public transport,schools and only 2-3 minute drive from the CBD. This fabulous property awaits very lucky new owners.A selection of furniture would be available for sale to the new owner.

Description:
COUNTRY LIFESTYLE LIVING! -
* 10 Acres of fully fenced farm land, including paddocks.
* Four bedrooms, main with ensuite and WIR, other three bedrooms with BIR's.
* Two spacious living areas & very functional pier style kitchen.
* Massive 15 x 9m steel shed with 12' ceilings, concrete floor and power.
* Hard stand area for trucks, trailers, or simply run the harrows over it and create another paddock.
This solid brick home is only 20 minutes from Bendigo, Castlemaine and just over an hour from Melbourne.
With no maintenance required and plenty of land for a pool, ponies, sheep and chooks this property offers the option of simply moving in with nothing to do or plenty of space in which to create your own hobby farm dreams.
Lockwood south is an expanding rural/residential area with a popular primary school with 135 students only minutes away.
Secondary school buses also stop nearby in this popular Bendigo suburb.
With employment in Bendigo flourishing this property provides the gateway to both the rewards of rural living and easy access to the benefits of being so close to a regional city.

Description:
DESIGNER TOWNHOUSE - 4.48% ROI
Are you looking to invest in a stunning townhouse in a premier location 950m from the centre of Bendigo? This new two bedroom townhouse is double glazed, brilliantly positioned and built to exacting standards. Designed and built by Russell Parsons, it has been fitted out with quality appliances and fittings throughout. Downstairs consists of 1 bedroom with built in robes and luxury ensuite, and a large rear 2 car garage. Upstairs the master bedroom has a walk in robe and two way bathroom. The open plan kitchen, living dining area opens out onto a balcony that looks out over the oval and walking track. The kitchen has stainless steel Miele appliances and stone benches. Currently tenanted until October 2020 to a professional tenant at $430 per week giving a 4.48% return on investment, while the suburb has enjoyed 6.56% average annual growth. Low maintenance, no body corporate fees and builders warranty all make this an investment opportunity not to be missed!
Source: Monthly data update for Apr 2020 as supplied by CoreLogic. Data is reported to the period ending Jan 2020.

Description:
3 bedroom family home in a quiet and convenient location!
Set back from the street, on a generous 667m2 block is this original, one-owner weatherboard treasure. Presenting the perfect foundation for first home buyers or families to renovate or create their dream home in a near central location.
The well-kept home features a classic weatherboard construction, complemented by an original style floor plan. Comprising a comfortable lounge area to the left upon entry, which wraps around into the formal dining and open kitchen space which features an abundance of storage and an upright gas stove/oven.
You are welcomed to the master bedroom on the right upon entry. The largest of three, featuring a built-in robe and views of the front garden. The central hallway allows access to the remaining two bedrooms, one with a built-in robe, the three-piece bathroom, laundry, linen press and the rear access.
Externally, the property features well maintained gardens, drive through car port and a large lock-up shed perfect for storage of vehicles or trades equipment. Finally, reap the benefits of an existing solar panel system installed to keep those electricity bills low all year round.
Located in a quiet street, only a stones throw away from shops and school's, with the nearest bus stop only 100 metres away, it is as convenient as they come.
24 Green Street, California Gully is not expected to last long so get in touch with Toby Gray (0468 708 785) to arrange a private viewing.
(ENOE)

Address: Lot 4 Coleman Close (Off Kronk Street) Maiden Gully VIC 3551
Description:
Country Style Allotments Minutes to CBD
Located centrally between the amenities of Golden Square and Maiden Gully, and just five minutes from the centre of Bendigo, is this last available allotment in a prestigious development. This boutique subdivision is positioned off popular Kronk Street and with all of the other blocks already sold and works commencing, this is a rare opportunity to secure the final allotment.
Lot 4, on just over three acres, is predominantly level ensuring the space is ready and waiting to build on.
The block enjoys a country feel with established native trees and picturesque and tranquil surrounds providing the perfect combination of a rural feel with city conveniences.
Additional features include:
- Zoned Low Density Residential
- BAL rating of 12.5
- Services Available
- Soil Report and Land Capability Statements available
- No building envelope required
This is a fantastic opportunity to secure a large allotment close to all amenities and to the centre of the city. Last block available and the remaining allotments in the estate building homes of a quality standard, this is an excellent chance to create your dream home in a fantastic locale.

Description:
ENOUGH SPACE FOR ALL!
Positioned in a lovely elevated position in the popular older part of Maiden Gully is larger-than-average family home with plenty of extras on offer at a realistic price.
The private allotment is on over 2678m2 with a long driveway, lovely grassed area to one side and is relatively easy-care for a larger allotment.
The home boasts three living spaces including a carpeted lounge with bay window towards the front of the home, an open-plan kitchen-meals family space with Northerly aspect and a large rumpus room with cork flooring and a reverse cycle split system; this room has sliding doors leading through to the second of two outdoor living options which is a large Merbau decked area with views. The kitchen is in very good order; it features a 600mm cooker with gas hot plates and electric oven, corner pantry, dishwasher, cork floor and ample cabinetry.
The adjacent meals space has a large wood heater and timber sliding door which leads to the second alfresco space - this is also North-West facing with views to a lovely grassed area.
Three bedrooms have built-in-robes; the main boasts a walk-in-robe and en suite, the laundry is a good size with plenty of storage and the family bathroom has been recently updated and includes a 900mm shower, separate bath, vanity and extensive tiling throughout.
There are colonial windows, ducted evaporative cooling throughout and Holland blinds, veranda's and privacy.
Outside is a double carport with room to open your doors, two water tanks and a superb barn-style shed! The shed boasts a sound-proof studio, mezzanine and a large man-cave style space with pot-belly heater and some lined walls.
This property has a bit of everything and is ripe for someone looking for some space. Only a short drive to Bendigo, the new Marist College is close by and you're very handy to the Maiden Gully shopping strip.
Internal area
179m²

Description:
UNDER OFFER | WALK TO HOSPITAL, LAKE WEEROONA & CBD
This fully renovated, weatherboard Californian Bungalow is ideally located, a short walk to Bendigos new hospital precinct, Lake Weeroona and the CBD, ensuring the citys cafes and eateries are all within easy reach. Sitting behind a picket fence, the character property provides charm from the outset with a wide porch at the front entry.
Indoors, a central hallway leads to the three bedrooms, one of which offers an original fireplace with a gas log fire. Double sash windows, wide timber flooring and high ceilings all ensure much of the original character of the home has been retained.
A spacious lounge can also be found off the central hallway and running across the rear of the home is a light-filled open plan kitchen and dining space. The brand-new kitchen enjoys a modern-country style with ample storage and contemporary appliances. Off the dining space is a brand-new bathroom with semi-freestanding bathtub.
French doors from the dining space lead out to a spacious alfresco deck, perfect for outdoor entertaining. This overlooks the neat rear yard, which is mainly set to lawn.
Additional features include:
Gas wall heating and gas log fire
Gas log fire in main bedroom.
Split system heating and cooling
Fully renovated with new interior and exterior paintwork
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, oven and four-burner induction cooktop
Single lock up carport
Good off-street parking
With not a thing to do, this property is ideal for young professionals, a first home buyer, or an investor seeking a home with fantastic proximity to all amenities. Walking distance to everything you may need, this charming, easy-care property is one to enjoy.

Description:
Immaculate 3 Bedroom Home with Studio
Backing onto a peaceful bush reserve this immaculate property has been beautifully cared for by its current owners.
Facing north, the lovely home is filled with light, and at the rear of the home are tranquil bush views.
Upon entry is a bright lounge, kitchen and dining area.
The good sized kitchen includes new stove with gas cook top and electric self-cleaning oven, and plenty of bench space.
At the front of the home are 3 good sized bedrooms, all with built-in robes, a centrally located 3-piece bathroom, plus laundry and separate toilet. Year-round comfort is assured with 3 new reverse-cycle split-systems for heating and cooling to the entire home.
A fabulous new studio positioned at the rear of the yard overlooks the bush reserve.
The studio can be used for a variety of projects as it is fully-insulated and lined, built with full council permits and is separately powered with its own switchboard and safety switch.
Other features include a solar system, lock up carport, under cover patio area, and also a back gate for easy access to the reserve and walking tracks.
Conveniently positioned close to a bus stop and the local IGA supermarket, and a short drive to Bendigo hospital and CBD.
Set in a quiet street backing onto bushland with an abundance of bird life, this property is a must to inspect.
